definition.sentence: Case frames provide a high-level set of syntactic and semantic expectations that can be applied to the input in a variety of ways .
definition.definiens: provide a high-level set of syntactic and semantic expectations that can be applied to the input in a variety of ways

definition.sentence: Ellipsis is a many-faceted phenomenon .
definition.definiens: a many-faceted phenomenon

definition.sentence: System : A dual ported disk .

definition.sentence: Additionally , DYPAR-II contains rules to ensure semantic completeness of utterances even in the absence of specific discourse expectations .
Natural language is a desirable access mechanism for data base systems because it frees the user from the task of understanding the details of the data base structure .
definition.definiens: a desirable access mechanism for data base systems because it frees the user from the task of understanding the details of the data base structure

definition.sentence: This paper describes a system , PIQUE , which implements this approach by retaining a model of the user 's view and considering possible methods of performing the update in light of the model .
definition.definiens: implements this approach by retaining a model of the user 's view and considering possible methods of performing the update in light of the model

definition.sentence: For instance , in the example in section 2 , the view function , as defined by Q1 , is a transformation consisting of a join and a projection , which is applied to the original two files to yield a single new file with only two attributes .
definition.definiens: a transformation consisting of a join and a

definition.sentence: Loosely defined , a homomorphism is a function that preserves the structure of its arguments under given operations .
definition.definiens: a function that preserves the structure of its arguments under given operations

definition.sentence: A referentially opaque context is one in which two expressions that refer to the same real world concept can not be interchanged in the context without changing the meaning of the utterance ( Quine 1971 ) .
definition.definiens: one in which two expressions that refer to the same real world concept can not be interchanged in the context without changing the meaning of the utterance

definition.sentence: Language driven inference is a style of natural language processing in which the inferencing process is driven ( and hence limited ) by the phrasing of the user 's request .
definition.definiens: a style of natural language processing in which the inferencing process is driven ( and hence limited ) by the phrasing of the user 's request

definition.sentence: Note that update ( 1 ) also has potential side effects on the user 's view , but the violation of the pragmatic constraint is a stronger reason for rejection .
definition.definiens: 1 ) also has potential side effects on the user 's view , but the violation of the

definition.sentence: Coverage concerns the range of inputs accepted by the system .
definition.definiens: the range of inputs accepted by the system

definition.sentence: The class of queries accepted by PIQUE is a natural ( and common ) subset of the relational calculus expressions : chain-structured , conjunctive queries .
definition.definiens: a natural ( and common ) subset of the relational calculus expressions : chain-structured , conjunctive queries

definition.sentence: Efficiency concerns the time and space requirements of the system , and how these increase as the data base becomes larger .
definition.definiens: concerns the time and space requirements of the system , and how these increase as the data base becomes larger

definition.sentence: A semantic domain is a set of objects .
definition.definiens: a set of objects

definition.sentence: A declarative sentence is a proposition that is , something to which a truth value can be assigned .

definition.sentence: A template is a structure , based on slots for three semantic formulas that can themselves have dependent formulas , such that the whole structure represents a possible `` message '' .
definition.definiens: a structure , based on slots for three semantic formulas that can themselves

definition.sentence: STYLISTIC WEAKNESS : MISSING COMMA IN COMPOUND SENTENCE .

In natural language processing , useful grammar formalisms have been developed and incorporated in Prolog : metamorphosis grammars , due to Colmerauer ( 1978 ) , and extraposition grammars , defined by F. Pereira ( 1981 ) ; definite clause grammars ( Pereira and Warren 1980 ) are a special case of metamorphosis grammars .
definition.definiens: a special case of metamorphosis grammars

definition.sentence: Perhaps the most general and powerful metagrammatical device for handling coordination in computational linguistics has been the SYSCONJ facility for augmented transition networks ( ATNs ) ( Woods 1973 ; Bates 1978 ) .
definition.definiens: Perhaps the most general and powerful metagrammatical device for handling coordination in computational linguistics has been the SYSCONJ facility for augmented transition networks

definition.sentence: The system consists of three things : ( 1 ) a new formalism for logic grammars , which we call modifier structure grammars ( MSGs ) , ( 2 ) an interpreter ( or parser ) for MSGs that takes all the responsibility for the syntactic aspects of coordination ( as with SYSCONJ ) , and ( 3 ) a semantic interpretation component that produces logical forms from the output of the parser and deals with scoping problems for coordination .
definition.definiens: consists of three things : ( 1 ) a new formalism for logic grammars , which we call modifier structure grammars ( MSGs ) , ( 2 ) an interpreter ( or parser ) for MSGs that takes all the responsibility for the syntactic aspects of coordination ( as with SYSCONJ ) , and ( 3 ) a semantic interpretation component that produces logical forms from the output of the parser and deals with scoping problems for coordination

definition.sentence: However , our system has the following interesting features : ( 1 ) The MSG interpreter manipulates stacks in such a way that embedded coordination ( and coordination of more than two elements ) and interactions with extraposition are handled .
definition.definiens: manipulates stacks in such a way that embedded coordination ( and coordination of more than two elements

definition.sentence: F. Pereira 's ( 1981 ) extraposition grammars ( XGs ) are essentially generalizations of MGs designed to handle ( left ) extraposition .
definition.definiens: essentially generalizations of MGs designed to handle ( left ) extraposition

definition.sentence: The basic form is A : Sem -- > B. where A -- > B is an XG rule and Sem is a term called a semantic item , which plays a role in the semantic interpretation of a phrase analyzed by application of the rule .
definition.definiens: A : Sem -- > B. where A -- > B is an XG rule
a term called a semantic item
plays a role in the semantic interpretation of a phrase analyzed by application of the rule

definition.sentence: The semantic item is ( as in McCord 1981 ) of the form Operator-LogicalForm where , roughly , LogicalForm is the part of the logical form of the sentence contributed by the rule , and Operator determines the way this partial structure combines with others .
definition.definiens: the part of the logical form of the sentence contributed by the rule

definition.sentence: Then the modifier structure of the phrase is a term of the form syn ( NT , Sem , Mods ) where NT is the leading symbol ( a non-terminal ) in A and where Mods is the list of modifier structures of the subphrascs analyzed with the right-hand side B of the rule .
definition.definiens: a term of the form syn ( NT , Sem , Mods ) where
the leading symbol ( a non-terminal ) in A and where Mods is the list of modifier structures of the subphrascs analyzed with the right-hand side B of the rule

definition.sentence: An MSG rule A : Sem -- > B is preprocessed into a term rule ( NT , Ext , Sem , B 1 ) where NT is the leading non-terminal in A , Ext is the conversion of the remainder of A into an extraposition list , and B1 is the conversion of B to list form .
definition.definiens: the conversion of the remainder of A into an extraposition list
the conversion of B to list form

definition.sentence: A node in such a list is of the form x ( Context , Type , Symbol , Ext ) where Context is either 'gap ' or 'nogap ' , Type is either 'terminal ' or 'nonterminal ' , Symbol is a grammar symbol , and Ext is the remainder of the list .
definition.definiens: a grammar symbol
the remainder of the list

definition.sentence: This procedure calls the main working procedure prs ( BodyList , String , Mods , Par , Mer , Ext ) which parses String against a list BodyList of goals of the type that can appear in the right-hand side ( the body ) of a rule .
definition.definiens: the body ) of a rule

definition.sentence: A non-empty parent stack is a term of the form parent ( BodyList , Mods , Par ) where BodyList is a body list , Mods is a modifier list , and Par is again a parent stack .
definition.definiens: a term of the form parent ( BodyList , Mods , Par ) where BodyList is a body list
a modifier list , and

definition.sentence: In particular , context-free rules augmented with procedures may be written , since even the simplest logic grammar defined to date ( DCGs ) allows Prolog calls to be interspersed with the rules .
definition.definiens: allows Prolog calls to be interspersed with the rules

definition.sentence: Our suggested solution to these conflicts involves an enhanced form of controlled Production System ( PS ) , which combines maximal transparency and modularity with the advantages of the characteristically declarative and locally unstructured organisation of the typical PS architecture .
definition.definiens: combines maximal transparency and modularity with the advantages of the characteristically declarative and locally unstructured organisation of the typical PS architecture

definition.sentence: The NOMAD system takes unedited English input in a constrained domain , and works interactively with the user to encode the message into database-readable form .
definition.definiens: takes unedited English input in a constrained domain , and works interactively with the user to encode the message into database-readable form

definition.sentence: FOUL-UP worked with the SAM system ( Cullingford 1977 ) , using the expectations generated by scripts ( Schank and Abelson 1977 ) to restrict the possible meanings of a word , based on what object or action would have occurred in that position according to the script for the story .
definition.definiens: a word , based on what object or action would have occurred in that position according to the script for the story

definition.sentence: Interpretation failures , on the other hand , are defined as those that can not be easily ascribable to the failure of some particular pre-defined surface expectation ; these arise after some conceptual analysis has been successfully performed and the resulting representation fails to match pragmatic checks such as goalbased or script-based knowledge of the situation being described .
definition.definiens: script-based knowledge of the situation being described

definition.sentence: The former interpretation ( that bomb is a verb ) also gives rise to a 'missing-clause-boundary ' surface alert , since then the 'returned ' and 'bombs ' verbs would be next to each other .
definition.definiens: a verb

definition.sentence: At this point , NOMAD uses a mechanism we term 'ACT-preference ' ( Granger 1977 ) , which exploits both pragmatic knowledge of what enemies tend to do with weapons , and wordorder knowledge that we have derived of how particular triads of prepositions , noun-categories , and verb-categories tend to combine ( for example , 'BLAGHED < weapon > AT < ship > ' will give rise to a different inference than 'BLAGHED < weapon > TO < ship > ' , or 'BLAGHED < weapon > FOR < ship > ' , etc. ) .
definition.definiens: exploits both pragmatic knowledge of what enemies tend to do with weapons , and wordorder knowledge that we have derived of how particular triads of prepositions , noun-categories , and verb-categories tend to combine ( for example , 'BLAGHED < weapon > AT < ship > ' will give rise to a different inference than 'BLAGHED < weapon > TO < ship > ' , or 'BLAGHED < weapon > FOR < ship > '

definition.sentence: Finally , NOMAD produces an interpretation of the input , which the user may or may not confirm .
definition.definiens: produces an interpretation of the input , which the user may or may not confirm

definition.sentence: 'Fired ' builds a PROPEL , and expects a subject and objects to play the conceptual roles of ACTOR ( who did the PROPELing ) , OBJECT ( what got PROPELed ) and RECIPIENT ( who got PROPELed at ) .
definition.definiens: builds a PROPEL , and expects a subject and objects to play the conceptual roles of ACTOR

definition.sentence: However , NOMAD contains the knowledge that enemies do not transfer control of weapons , information , personnel , etc. , to each other .
Hence it attempts to find an alternative interpretation of the sentence , in this case finding the `` returned fire '' interpretation , which does not violate any of NOMAD 's knowledge about goals .
definition.definiens: does not violate any of NOMAD 's knowledge about goals

definition.sentence: NOMAD OUTPUT : An unknown enemy ship fired on us .
definition.definiens: An unknown enemy ship fired on us

definition.sentence: The NOMAD and VOX systems are the latAmerican Journal of Computational Linguistics , Volume 9 , Numbers 3-4 , July-December 1983 195 Richard H. Granger The NOMAD System est in a line of 'tolerant ' language understanders , beginning with FOUL-UP , all based on the use of knowledge of syntax , semantics , and pragmatics at all stages of the understanding process to cope with errors .
definition.definiens: of 'tolerant ' language understanders , beginning with FOUL-UP , all based on the use of knowledge of syntax , semantics , and pragmatics at all stages of the understanding process to cope with errors

definition.sentence: Moreover , the CO-OP paraphraser generates a question that differs in a meaningful way from the original question .
definition.definiens: generates a question that differs in a meaningful way from the original question

definition.sentence: When the direct response to a question would be simply `` no '' or `` none '' , CO-OP gives a more informative response by correcting the questioner 's mistaken assumptions .
definition.definiens: gives a more informative response by correcting the questioner 's mistaken assumptions

definition.sentence: Subtree nodes ( the leaves of Figure 1 ) have three pieces of information associated with them : • the relation between the node and its parent , • the noun phrase the node represents , and • an indication of whether the node functions as subject or object in the clause .

definition.sentence: A node consists of : • arc-label • set-label • subject/object where arc-label is the label of a binary relation in the input parse tree ( i.e. , a verb or preposition ) and setlabel is the label of a set in the input parse ( i.e. , noun phrase ) .
definition.definiens: the label of a binary relation in the input parse tree ( i.e. , a verb or preposition

definition.sentence: The substitution of synonyms , phrases , or idioms for portions or all of the question requires an examination of the effect of context on word meaning and of the intentions of the speaker on word or phrase choice .
